In addition to the YAML parameters shown in the first example, this example letter includes the parameter `return-short` which allows for a different, possibly shorter sender's address to fit in the window.

<br>

### RMarkdown of Letter
<!-- This weird setup of the chunk is necessary because the letter contains 
a ```-chunk which is hard to get around when included in a chunk. -->

````markdown
```{r cars, results='asis', echo=FALSE}
cat(paste(readLines('letter_example4.Rmd')[!grepl('ignette', x=readLines('letter_example4.Rmd'))], collapse ='\n'))
```
````

<br>

### Resulting PDF Letter

PDF rendered via `rmarkdown::render()` or the RStudio Knit button from RMarkdown document above.

```{r render-pdf, include=FALSE}
rmarkdown::render("letter_example4.Rmd", output_file="pkgdown_ex4.pdf", output_dir='.')
pdftools::pdf_convert(pdf='pkgdown_ex4.pdf', dpi=150, format="jpeg", pages=1, filenames="pkgdown_ex4.jpg")
```
